Name: Atish
Uses: The dry root is powdered and taken orally with lukewarm water twice a day for 3-4 days.

Name: Patish
Uses: The dry root is powdered and taken orally with lukewarm water twice a day for one week.

Name: Patish
Uses: A decoction of dry roots of patish and karu (Picrrorhiza kurroa) is prepared and taken orally at bed time

Name: Boz,Bach
Uses: The dried rhizome is powdered and mixed with water. A thick paste is applied on affected areas.

Name: Boz, Bach
Uses: The dry root is powdered and taken orally as such with lukewarm water once a day.

Name: Faran, Duno
Uses: The fresh leaves are crushed and taken orally with milk.

Name: Chora
Uses: Roots are powdered and taken orally as such with water twice a day.

Name: Ratanjot
Scientific Name: Arnebia benthami (Wall. Ex G. Don.) Johnston
Uses: Dry roots are soaked in mustard oil for more than one week and the warm oil is massaged on the affected part(s) at bedtime.

Name: Ratanjot
Scientific Name: Arnebia benthami (Wall. Ex G. Don.) Johnston
Uses: The dry roots are soaked in mustard oil for more than one week till its color changes to reddish pink. The oil is massaged.

Name: Jhaoo
Uses: Leaf juice is extracted. Leaf juice is used as an ear drop. The Treatment is undertaken once a day.

Name: Kshamal
Uses: The flowers are boiled in water and filtered. The extract is taken orally.

Name: Kshamal
Uses: Roots are boiled in water and filtered. The filtrate is used as an eye drop. The treatment is undertaken twice a day for one week.

Name: Dhatura
Uses: Dried seeds are roasted on iron pan and powdered after cooling. The powder is mixed with hot mustard oil to make a paste. A thick paste is applied on the affected parts at bed time.

Name: Hieun-sheli
Uses: Fresh leaves are crushed and a thick paste is made. A thick paste is applied externally on the affected parts.

Name: Salampanja
Uses: The rhizome is powdered. The powder is taken orally with lukewarm water. The powder is taken twice a day for three days

Name: Fagar
Uses: The latex of the stem is squeezed out.2-3 drops of latex are applied on aching teeth and gums

Name: Neelkanthi
Uses: The leaves are boiled in water and filtered. The extract is taken orally.

Name: Bichoo-Ga
Uses: The whole plant is swept on the affected part. Until the patient feels relaxed and improved

Name: Bichoo-Ga
Uses: Fresh leaves are crushed and mixed with cow dung. The mixture is warmed by heating. The mixture is wrapped in a cotton cloth and tied on affected portion. The Treatment is undertaken at bedtime.

Name: Kachoor
Uses: The dry rhizome is powdered. The powder is taken orally with lukewarm water once in a day

Name: Shalgar
Uses: Fresh leaves are crushed to make a paste. A thick paste is applied externally on the affected parts. The Treatment is undertaken twice a day for one week.

Name: Guggibaan
Uses: The flower is dried. The wool of the herb is applied to fresh cuts and seals the wound. The dry wool is applied per day.

Name: Timber
Uses: The bark is removed from the stem. Small piece of bark is chewed for 4- 5 minutes.
